common_issues.title: Connection Issues with Pieces OS
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties connecting to Pieces OS from various platforms, including VS Code remote environments and web extensions. This is often due to changes in Pieces OS network configurations or issues with API calls. Solutions include updating to the latest Pieces OS and extension versions, configuring network settings, and using alternative connection methods.

related_issues.title: Seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment (VS Code running remote docker container)
related_issues.text: Seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment (VS Code running remote docker container) ### Software VS Code ### Operating System / Platform macOS ### Your Pieces OS Version 11.02 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. I'm having the same problem as this: https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/269 Using VS Code project within a docker container and getting this message: > Woops! It seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment & Pieces for VS Code cannot connect to Pieces OS. Please refer to our documentation on how to resolve this issue. ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ffeb53fd-0787-4bc2-9faf-c5f3d179294b) Pieces OS version: ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/640d35af-6106-4717-9269-c51205ff23fb) I followed this guide but with no luck: https://docs.pieces.app/product-highlights-and-benefits/connecting-to-a-remote-pieces-os-instance LAN IP: VS Code settings, pieces custom URL: ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/aaed7eb8-36e7-49cb-b6e0-84271adb8027) What else can I try? Thanks! ## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation **Key Points Raised:** * Malanciault encountered an error message when trying to connect to Pieces OS from a VSCode DevContainer. * The error persisted even without a project opened in VSCode. * Remote projects failed to connect while non-remote projects functioned as expected. **Problems Identified:** * The Pieces Server's default listening interface changed to loopback in version 11.0.0, preventing remote connections. * Docker's `host.docker.internal` resolution did not work with Pieces OS webview tool windows. **Solutions Proposed/Implemented:** * Issue a patch to allow Pieces Server to listen on all interfaces. * A patch was implemented and released as version 2.0.2 of the Pieces for VSCode extension. **Current Status/Outcome:** * The issue is resolved with the updated extension version. **Additional Notes:** * A temporary workaround was suggested involving DNS configuration, but was no longer necessary with the patch. * A video call was considered to further troubleshoot the issue before the patch was released.

related_issues.title: Failed to load resource: net::ERR_CONNECTION_REFUSED     http://127.0.0.1:1000/.well-known/health
related_issues.text:
Failed to load resource: net::ERR_CONNECTION_REFUSED     http://127.0.0.1:1000/.well-known/health
### Software

Web Extension

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Chrome browser slows to a crawl while hundreds of these errors are issued:
Failed to load resource: net::ERR_CONNECTION_REFUSED     http://127.0.0.1:1000/.well-known/health   

Disabling the extension stops it, re-enabling invokes it again
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* Developer console filled with errors after Chrome extension update (user: SteveW555)

**Problems Identified:**

* Issue similar to https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/562
* Related to multiple well-known/health api calls during reload

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Fix will be included in the upcoming release of the Chrome extension (by rutvik-at-pieces)

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue closed as duplicate of https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/562
* Fix expected to be available in the next day or two

related_issues.title: Copilot Bug: 'I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please...' copilot response
related_issues.text:
Copilot Bug: 'I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please...' copilot response
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

hi i have been using it for 2 days but for the last 2 hours the desktop and visual studio extension are not working. 

No matter what I type, it gives me this error. There was an update message for the app, it was about installing a version, I installed it but it didn't fix it.
always the same message 
visual studio ide 2022 17.12 
windows 10 pro
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c64d85bd-eb1a-4f1c-a25e-570c9a55ccd1)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/55b600a6-95f4-4e71-aee1-1b1ce8b6599c)


## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* Users are experiencing issues with OpenAI models (Claude and Gemini) not functioning properly.
* These issues seem to be affecting both the GPT-3.5 and Claude models.

**Problems Identified:**

* Some users' OpenAI API keys are becoming invalidated over time.
* There appears to be an issue with the integration between OpenAI models and Pieces that is causing failures.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* **For OpenAI API key invalidation issue:**
    * Remove the OpenAI API key from Pieces and attempt to use without it.
    * Update Pieces to version 11.0.3.
    * Sign in to Pieces to access a higher rate limit.
    * If issues persist, use an OpenAI model instead of Claude or Gemini.
* **For integration issue:**
    * Investigated and addressed by the Pieces team.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Investigating and fixing the integration issue is ongoing.
* Users are advised to use OpenAI models temporarily until the issue is resolved.
* Users who can operate without an OpenAI API key are advised to do so to avoid potential failures.

**Overall:**

The Pieces team is aware of the issues and actively working on solutions. Users are encouraged to follow the proposed workarounds and report any further problems they encounter.

common_issues.title: Copilot and plugin unresponsiveness, errors
common_issues.description: Users report Copilot unresponsiveness, errors, and processing issues across platforms. Solutions include using specific PiecesOS versions (11.0.3, 11.0.4), signing into Pieces, avoiding OpenAI API keys, and waiting for bug fixes. Issues with context, line numbers, and scrolling are being investigated.

    * Update Pieces to version 11.0.3.
    * Sign in to Pieces to access a higher rate limit.
    * If issues persist, use an OpenAI model instead of Claude or Gemini.
* **For integration issue:**
    * Investigated and addressed by the Pieces team.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

The Pieces team is aware of the issues and actively working on solutions. Users are encouraged to follow the proposed workarounds and report any further problems they encounter.

related_issues.title: Copilot is not giving any feedback
related_issues.text:
Copilot is not giving any feedback
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

Pieces for Developers 3.3.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The copilot is not generating anything, it just keeps on loading.
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points:**

* User @gittydia reported an issue with Copilot response saying "I'm sorry, something went wrong with the processing..."
* Pieces support bot automatically triaged the issue and responded with related issues and resources.
* Mark-at-pieces, a Pieces team member, stated that a fix is expected in the upcoming PiecesOS release 11.0.4.

**Problems identified:**

* Copilot response error message: "I'm sorry, something went wrong with the processing..."

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Fix for the issue is included in the upcoming PiecesOS release 11.0.4.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Fix is expected to be released with PiecesOS 11.0.4. User is requested to report back if the issue persists after the update.

related_issues.title: Pieces plugin for UltraEdit is unresponsive after asking copilot to describe ~3000 line .py script
related_issues.text:
Pieces plugin for UltraEdit is unresponsive after asking copilot to describe ~3000 line .py script
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

In UltraEdit I opened the python script available at https://github.com/eldraco/domain_analyzer/blob/master/domain_analyzer.py. I opened the Pieces plugin and using default settings prompted it to describe the script: "What does this Python script do?" The UE plugin never returns any content and seems to be unresponsive. 

In Pieces Desktop, I do see the result, however interaction with it is latent indicating some sort of continual background processing even though the LLM has completed processing. Additionally, there seem to be significant scroll issues, and the code view doesn't appear to be calculating line numbers correctly, showing many empty lines after line 1,918, when line 2,837 is the last line in the file.

Finally, the Pieces Desktop code view shows a wrap in the line number margin.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9be69032-f2e2-4379-843c-cd0bf14da63a)
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Issue:** 
Problems with context and line number wrapping in Pieces with Gemini 1.5 flash and gpt4o.

**Key Points:**

* User @bschwenk reported issues with context and line number wrapping while using Pieces with Gemini 1.5 flash and gpt4o.
* @mark-at-pieces confirmed the issue and started investigating.
* @sam-at-pieces was requested to assist with testing.
* @mack-at-pieces was asked to look into the line number wrapping issue.

**Solutions:**

* Investigate and resolve the context issue, causing the system to request the file despite having been downloaded.
* Fix the line number wrapping issue.

**Current Status:**

* Both issues are being investigated and are expected to be resolved in the next patch.

**Outcome:**

* The problems with context and line number wrapping will be fixed with the next patch, improving the user experience with Pieces.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Performance Issues
common_issues.description: Users report high RAM/CPU usage, especially with Live Context. Short-term fix: restart PiecesOS. Long-term: devs optimizing resource consumption, suggest turning off Live Context.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
Several users have called in recently about Pieces using too much RAM or causing a spike in CPU up to 100%. We are trying to track down this issue, and would appreciate any feedback about your experience with this if you are experiencing it. 

We have a hunch it has something to do with internet connections, but aren't fully sure yet. 

If you're experiencing this and wouldn't mind hopping on a call with us to show us, we would really appreciate it to help us troubleshoot! You can schedule a call [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/0/appointments/schedules/AcZssZ2iaRWpd1kA2k_xg2KrVi_jiTHo0POiMZSI9WAYsxs5jJ9sU2Rd2zKitLuSFd7l3FhatGzy5Vgt
). 

A short-term solution is to restart PiecesOS whenever this occurs. 
## Summary of GitHub issue conversation: Pieces OS high memory and CPU usage

**Key Points:**

* Several users report high memory and CPU usage by PiecesOS, particularly when using the Live Context feature.
* Memory usage can reach up to 5 GB in some cases.
* CPU usage can lead to system slowdown.

**Problems Identified:**

* **High memory consumption:** PiecesOS uses a significant amount of RAM, impacting system performance.
* **CPU spikes:** Background processes cause sudden and high CPU usage.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* **Live Context optimization:** Turning off the Live Context feature may reduce memory usage.
* **Memory optimization tool:** PiecesOS offers an "Optimize Memory" option to free up RAM.
* **Ongoing improvements:** The Pieces team is actively working on optimizing resource consumption.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue remains ongoing, and some users have opted to stop using PiecesOS due to performance concerns.
* Further improvements and optimizations are expected.

**Additional Notes:**

* High resource usage is attributed to on-device ML processing.
* The Pieces team encourages users experiencing excessive resource usage to contact them for troubleshooting.

**Next Steps:**

* Monitor future updates from the Pieces team regarding performance improvements.
* Consider using alternative tools or workflows that are less resource-intensive.

Pieces plugin for UltraEdit is unresponsive after asking copilot to describe ~3000 line .py script
### Software

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

In UltraEdit I opened the python script available at https://github.com/eldraco/domain_analyzer/blob/master/domain_analyzer.py. I opened the Pieces plugin and using default settings prompted it to describe the script: "What does this Python script do?" The UE plugin never returns any content and seems to be unresponsive. 

In Pieces Desktop, I do see the result, however interaction with it is latent indicating some sort of continual background processing even though the LLM has completed processing. Additionally, there seem to be significant scroll issues, and the code view doesn't appear to be calculating line numbers correctly, showing many empty lines after line 1,918, when line 2,837 is the last line in the file.

Finally, the Pieces Desktop code view shows a wrap in the line number margin.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9be69032-f2e2-4379-843c-cd0bf14da63a)
## GitHub Issue Summary

Problems with context and line number wrapping in Pieces with Gemini 1.5 flash and gpt4o.

**Key Points:**

* @mark-at-pieces confirmed the issue and started investigating.
* @sam-at-pieces was requested to assist with testing.
* @mack-at-pieces was asked to look into the line number wrapping issue.

**Solutions:**

* Investigate and resolve the context issue, causing the system to request the file despite having been downloaded.

**Current Status:**

**Outcome:**

related_issues.title: Copilot is not giving any feedback
related_issues.text:
Copilot is not giving any feedback
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

Pieces for Developers 3.3.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The copilot is not generating anything, it just keeps on loading.
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points:**

* User @gittydia reported an issue with Copilot response saying "I'm sorry, something went wrong with the processing..."
* Pieces support bot automatically triaged the issue and responded with related issues and resources.
* Mark-at-pieces, a Pieces team member, stated that a fix is expected in the upcoming PiecesOS release 11.0.4.

**Problems identified:**

* Copilot response error message: "I'm sorry, something went wrong with the processing..."

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Fix for the issue is included in the upcoming PiecesOS release 11.0.4.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Fix is expected to be released with PiecesOS 11.0.4. User is requested to report back if the issue persists after the update.

recommendations: **Prioritize Connection Issues:** Allocate additional resources to diagnose and resolve connection issues with Pieces OS, particularly from VS Code remote environments and web extensions. Update documentation with clear troubleshooting steps.

**Address Copilot Unresponsiveness:** Investigate and address the root causes of Copilot unresponsiveness and errors across platforms. Provide temporary workarounds to users while a permanent fix is being developed.
**Optimize PiecesOS Resource Consumption:** Continue optimizing PiecesOS to reduce RAM/CPU usage, especially for Live Context. Explore options for user-configurable performance settings.
**Improve Communication on Known Issues:** Proactively communicate known issues and workarounds to users through release notes, blog posts, and social media updates.
**Enhance Ticket Triaging:** Implement a more robust ticket triaging system to automatically categorize and prioritize issues based on severity and impact.
